html:
PC Number Date Chapter Chapter Year Bill Dept
 2025-02822025-03-05LAB, TC, ISC, NRCAN
ActCanada Labour Code
SubjectRegulations Amending Certain Regulations Made Under the Canada Labour Code
PrecisRegulations Amending CERTAIN REGULATIONS MADE UNDER THE CANADA LABOUR CODE in order to (1) correct potential ambiguities or misinterpretations and harmonize all five Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) regulations; (2) update expressions and language used in all five OHS regulations; (3) to amend the French wording in the Maritime Occupational Health and Safety Regulations (MOHSR) to ensure consistency in all five OHS Regulations; (4) amend the written list of reporting requirements in the MOHSR for the Employer Annual Hazardous Occurrence Report (EAHO Report); (5) amend the Policy Committees, Work Place Committees and Health and Safety Representative Regulations (PCWPCHSRR); (6) visually display hazardous occurrence report forms in the schedules of the regulations; and (7) make consequential administrative amendments to Schedule I of the Administrative Monetary Penalties (AMPs) Regulations.
RegistrationRegistration: SOR/ 2025-0079 Publication Date: 2025-03-26
AttachmentsAttachment
precis: Regulations Amending CERTAIN REGULATIONS MADE UNDER THE CANADA LABOUR CODE in order to (1) correct potential ambiguities or misinterpretations and harmonize all five Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) regulations; (2) update expressions and language used in all five OHS regulations; (3) to amend the French wording in the Maritime Occupational Health and Safety Regulations (MOHSR) to ensure consistency in all five OHS Regulations; (4) amend the written list of reporting requirements in the MOHSR for the Employer Annual Hazardous Occurrence Report (EAHO Report); (5) amend the Policy Committees, Work Place Committees and Health and Safety Representative Regulations (PCWPCHSRR); (6) visually display hazardous occurrence report forms in the schedules of the regulations; and (7) make consequential administrative amendments to Schedule I of the Administrative Monetary Penalties (AMPs) Regulations.
